request.description:
Create a new Staking flow with a `POST` request to `/api/v1/flows`.

### Parameters

*   `flow` - `object`
    *   `network_code` - `string` Network this flow operates on (ex. avalanche) (required)
    *   `chain_code` - `string` Chain this flow operates on (ex. mainnet) (required)
    *   `operation` `string` The operation to -perform (ex. staking) (required)
    *   `version` - `string` API version to use (ex. v1) (optional)

### Response

*   `id` - `string` ID of the newly created flow.
*   `state` - `string` The current state of the flow, i.e., `initialized`.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.
    

* * *

response.name: New Staking Flow

request.description:
Get the status of the existing flow using the `flow_id` from the previous step.

### Parameters

*   `flow_id` - `string` Pass the Flow ID you received in the response when creating the flow in the GET request URL, ex. `/flows/69d02e2c-bbde-4b09-bbe9-2be287a9a6de`.
    

### Response

*   `id` - `string` Id of the flow.
*   `state` - `string` The current state of the flow.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.
    

* * *

response.name: 200 - initialized

request.description:
After collecting the required inputs, send a `PUT` request to `/api/v1/flows/[:flow_id]/next` to move on to the next step.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array`
    *   `delegator_addresss` - `string` The delegating address (required).
    *   `validator_address` - `string` Address of the validator (required).
    *   `amount` - `number` The amount of AVAX to be delegated (required).
    *   `start_time` - `number` Adjust if you wish to set a specific delegation start time. [Epoch Unix Timestamp](https://www.unixtimestamp.com/), default is 5 minutes in the future (optional).
    *   `end_time` - `number` Adjust if you wish to set a specific delegation end time. [Epoch Unix Timestamp](https://www.unixtimestamp.com/), default is the end of the validator node lifetime (optional).
    *   `memo` - `string` Include a memo with the transaction (optional).

### Response

*   `id` - `string` ID of the newly created flow.
*   `state` - `string` Current state of the flow.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.
    
#### Important 
Please note that there is no concept of un-staking or un-delegating on Avalanche.  Delegations are active until the end time specified at delegation creation, and automatically deactivate and become liquid at that specified time.  This can not be changed once the delegation transaction is confirmed on-chain.  

* * *

Use `refresh_delegate_tx` if you need to get a fresh version of the transaction Payload (for example, if the nonce needs to be updated).

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array` There are no inputs for this action (optional).
    

### Response

The transaction payload is refreshed.

* * *

Submit a signed transaction payload ready to be broadcast to the network.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array`
    *   `transaction_payload` - `string` Transaction payload can be found in the response after creating the transaction. (required). **OR**
    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

### Response

The staking flow is complete.

* * *

request.description:
After collecting the required inputs, send a`PUT` request to `/api/v1/flows/[:flow_id]/next` to move on to the next step in the flow.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array` (required).
    *   `funding_account_address` - `string` The wallet ETH will be originating from (required).
    *   `validator_pub_key` - `string` The public key of the validator that the ETH is to be deposited to. (required).
    *   `withdrawal_credentials` - `string` The withdrawal address for the given validator. (required).
    *   `signature` - `string` A BLS proof of possession i.e., a proof that the private key corresponding to the `validator_pub_key` is known by the signer (required).
    *   `deposit_data_root` - `string` Uniquely identifies the set of deposits made so far (required).
    *   `amount` - `number` Number of tokens you want to delegate (required).
    *   `gas_price` - `string` Adjust the gas price (optional).
    *   `gas_limit` - `string` Adjust the gas limit (optional).

### Response

*   `id` - `string` ID of the newly created flow.
*   `state` - `string` Current state of the flow.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.
    

* * *

request.description:
Submit a signed transaction payload ready to be broadcast to the network.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array`
    *   `transaction_payload` - `string` Transaction payload can be found in the response after creating the transaction. (required). **OR**
    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

request.description:
Use the `assign_stash_and_controller_account` action if you already have a controller account set up and wish to add bond to it.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array`
    *   `controller_account_address` - `string` Address of the wallet DOT will be bonded to (required).
    *   `controller_proxy_account_address` - `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).
    *   `stash_account_address` - `string` Primary wallet from which DOT will be bonded (required).
    *   `stash_proxy_account_address` - `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).
    *   `validator_address` - `string` Address of the validator to whom you want to delegate your tokens.
    *   `reward_destination` - `string` Reward destination. (required) Indicates whether rewards are to be:
     1. Added to the staked balance (`staked`)
     2. Sent to the controller account, liquid (`controller`)
     3. Sent to the stash account, liquid (`stash`)
    *   `amount` - `number` - The amount of DOT to be bonded to the controller. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (ie. if you want to stake 5 DOT, return "amount": 5.0). Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor (required).

### Response

*   `id` - `string` ID of the newly created flow.
*   `state` - `string` Current state of the flow.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.
    

* * *

response.name: 200 - bonding_complete

request.description:
Use the `create_bonding_tx` action if you do not have a controller account set up and would like to create a controller and bond tokens.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `object`
    *   `controller_account_address` - `string` Address of the wallet DOT will be bonded to (required).
    *   `controller_proxy_account_address` - `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).
    *   `stash_account_address` - `string` Primary wallet from which DOT will be bonded.  Cannot have a zero balance. (required).
    *   `stash_proxy_account_address` - `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).
    *   `reward_destination` - `string` Reward destination. (required) Indicates whether rewards are to be:
     1.  Added to the staked balance (`Staked`), note the uppercase, `staked` will not work.
     2.  Sent to the controller account, liquid (`Controller`), note the uppercase, `controller` will not work.
     3.  Sent to the stash account, liquid (`Stash`), note the uppercase, `stash` will not work.
    *   `amount` - `number` - The amount of DOT to be bonded to the controller. Minimum of `1.0`. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (ie. if you want to stake 5 DOT, return `"amount": 5.0`). Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor (required).

### Response

Note that in this response you can find the unsigned, serialized transaction in `data[create_bonding_tx][raw]`.

*   `id` - `string` ID of the newly created flow.
*   `state` - `string` Current state of the flow.
*   `actions` - `array` The actions array contains the name of the next action in the flow and details of the expected inputs in the data field.

There are two possible `actions`:

- `refresh_bonding_tx` - If you need to get a fresh version of the transaction Payload (i.e., if the nonce needs to be updated).
- `sign_bonding_tx` - Submit a signed transaction Payload ready to be broadcast to the network.
    

* * *

Use `refresh_bonding_tx` if you need to get a fresh version of the transaction Payload (for example, if the nonce needs to be updated).

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `object` There are no inputs for this action (optional).
    

### Response

The transaction payload is refreshed.

* * *

Use the `sign_bonding_tx` action to submit a signed transaction payload.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).
*   `inputs` - `array`
    *   `transaction_payload` - `string` Transaction payload can be found in the response after creating the transaction. (required). **OR**
    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

### Response

With the signed transaction provided, Staking API will broadcast it to the network. As the transaction progresses towards confirmation, the returned `state` will be `bonding_tx_broadcasting.`

Upon transaction finalization, the bond will be complete and you can move on to the next step  the nomination transaction!

You may nominate anywhere from 1 to 16 validators on the Polkadot network. Your DOT will be distributed automatically by the network in the most efficient way at each epoch.

### Response

Note that in this response you can find the unsigned, serialized transaction in `data[create_nomination_tx][raw]`.

### Response

With the signed transaction provided, Staking API will broadcast it to the network. As the transaction progresses towards confirmation, the returned `state` will be `nomination_tx_broadcasting.`

Since nominations on Polkadot activate at the next epoch boundary (epochs are approximately 1 day), Staking API will also track the nomination and send a webhook notification when it activates.

Upon transaction finalization, the nomination will be complete and your stake is now active and earning rewards.

* * *

    *   `withdraw_authority_pubkey` - `string` Grants authority to sign certain withdrawal-related transactions to the provided address. Defaults to `funding_account_pubkey` (optional).
- `amount` - `number` The amount of SOL to be sent to the Stake Account. This field should be in full SOL, not in lamports (i.e., if you want to stake 5 SOL, return `"amount": 5.0`). Staking API will translate the amount to lamports so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor  (required).

Note that in this response you can find the unsigned, serialized transaction in `data[create_stake_account_transaction][raw]`.

    *   `transaction_payload` - `string` Transaction payload can be found in the response after creating the transaction. (required). **OR**
    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

### Response

With the signed transaction provided, Staking API will broadcast it to the network. As the transaction progresses towards confirmation, the returned state will be either:

- `stake_account_tx_broadcasting` - The transaction has been broadcast to the Solana cluster but not confirmed.
- `stake_account_tx_expired` - If the transaction has expired, it will automatically move the flow state back to `stake_account_tx_signature`.

Upon transaction finalization, the stake account will be ready for the next step  the delegation transaction.

Use the `sign_stake_account_tx` action to submit a signed transaction payload.

### Parameters

*   `name` - `string` Name of the action to execute (required).

    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

### Response

With the signed transaction provided, Staking API will broadcast it to the network. As the transaction progresses towards confirmation, the returned state will be either:

- `stake_account_tx_broadcasting` - The transaction has been broadcast to the Solana cluster but not confirmed.
- `stake_account_tx_expired` - If the transaction has expired, it will automatically move the flow state back to `stake_account_tx_signature`.

Upon transaction finalization, the stake account will be ready for the next step  the delegation transaction.

* * *

If you need to get a fresh version of the transaction payload (i.e., if the nonce needs to be updated)

*   `name` - `string` name of the action to execute (i.e., `refresh_delegate_tx`).

### Response

The transaction is broadcast to the network. Once it is confirmed, the staking flow is completed. Your stake is now active and earning rewards.

    *   `transaction_payload` - `string` Transaction payload can be found in the response after creating the transaction. (required). **OR**
    *   `signatures` - `array` An array of signatures. Staking API will sign the payload if this is provided (optional).

### Response

With the signed transaction provided, Staking API will broadcast it to the network. As the transaction progresses towards confirmation, the returned state will be:

- `transfer_tx_broadcasting` - The transaction has been broadcast and is waiting for confirmation.
- `confirmed` - The transfer transaction has been confirmed.
